item.title: Free IPv4 + IPv6 DNS hosting
item.description:
I have been a big fan of TunnelBroker.net’s IPv6 tunneling service for a number of years now, but I was pleasantly surprised to discover a new service from TunnelBroker.net (HE - Hurrican Electric) – IPv6 DNS hosting! Â Actually it’s dual-stack DNS hosting, allowing you to serve DNS requests for your domains to both the IPv4 and IPv6 internet.

It is currently in “open beta” status and available to anyone with a (free) ipv6 tunnelbroker.net account, or if you happen to be a customer of the parent company providing this service, HE (Hurricane Electric.)

item.title: New writer modules for BIND-DLZ's DNS Performance Testing Tools
item.description:
The BIND-DLZ project publishes an excellent set of performance testing toolswhich make it easy to generate a lot of fake DNS data for a variety of DNS server types.

I have extended this excellent tool set by creating a few new “writer” modules:

  • contrib::writers::mydns::file
  • contrib::writers::powerdns::xdb
  • contrib::writers::powerdns::sqlite3
  • contrib::writers::powerdns::gmysql
  • contrib::writers::windowsdns::file
